title: Stade Saint-Symphorien - FC Metz - Metz - The Stadium Guide
snippet: Club: FC Metz | Opening: 1923 | Capacity: 26,600 seats | Description: Stade Saint-Symphorien opened in 1923 and became the home ground of FC Metz in 1932 following the foundation of the club.

title: Stade Saint-Symphorien - Wikipedia
snippet: Stade Municipal Saint-Symphorien is a multi-purpose stadium located on the "island Saint-Symphorien" in Longeville-l√®s-Metz, near Metz, France. It is currently used mostly for football matches, by Ligue 1 club FC Metz. The stadium is able to hold 30,000 people and was built in 1923.

title: FC Metz - Stadium - Stade Saint-Symphorien | Transfermarkt
snippet: This page provides you with information about the stadium of the selected club. In addition to the basic facts, you can find the address of the stadium, access information, special features, prices in the stadium and name rights.

title: Metz Stadium
snippet: With this intervention, the south tribune will seat 8 000 fans instead of the current 3 500. This is a remodeling and expansion project for the Saint-Symphorien stadium that will globally increase the stadium's capacity by 4 440 seats: from 25,600 to 30,000 seats.

title: Stade St Symphorien (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
snippet: Superb football stadium with a great atmosphere. Plenty food outlets inside and restauranmt, bar and souvenir shop outside. Easy walking distance from cetre ...
